timotius_pamungkas wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi...
> 
> I'm working on an academic project for testing and grading student
> tasks (which are written in Java). I'm using JUnit, Java and Ant. I
> know that Ant's <junit> and <junitreport> can catch errors/failures,
> and generate the result. The problem is, this is not only about error
> reporting. For every student (every time I run ant's <junit> task), I
> need to catch the result for every single testXXX method, give some
> grade if the method pass, and store the grade in database for each
> student, so I can count the final grade later. I also need to display
> the result for every single testXXX method in swing (JTable perhaps)..
> 
> Can somebody tell me what kind of technique I have to use, or if you
> have any sample codes, references, or any articles, I will really
> appreciate it

Instead of trying to process test results as they happen, analyze the 
test result afterward, either using the TestResult object or by parsing 
the XML report that <junit> generates. Any test that doesn't have a 
failure or error is assumed to have passed.
--
